info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Elbert, central Hart and southwestern Anderson Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 703 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Elberton, or 6 miles northwest of Russell State Park, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Reed Creek, Lake Hartwell, Lake Russell, Rock Branch, Nuberg and Sadlers Creek State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
